intro: Eritrichium kungejense, commonly known as the Kungejense mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and wild plants. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and hairy, basal leaves. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
